result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph R Huddleston

defendant.name: Huddleston, Joseph R
defendant.address: 134 E. Forrerst St.  Lot #39, Lone Rock, WI

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Joseph R Huddleston in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Edward Covey in court for Joseph R Huddleston.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. VWS also appeared. 

22CF1 - Arraignment held, information on file. Atty. Covey addresses the Court - Defense waives reading of the information; it has been reviewed by the Def and Atty. Covey. Court states the charges and informs Def of the max. penalties. DA Harper confirms compliance with Ch 950. To all 20 counts of the information, NG pleas entered by the Defense. DA Harper informs the Court that the parties have an agreement whereby Def will change his pleas to Count 1 and 2; State will request a PSI; Defense has indicated they will request an alternate PSI; State is dismissing and reading in 22CF84; State is not referring this matter to the feds but makes no representation on what the feds may do with matter of manufacturing child pornography. Atty. Covey - Defense concedes it is aware the fed government is not bound by any agreement; notes Defense will be having a psychosexual evaluation done rather than an alternate PSI and expects that to take at least 6 weeks; Defense will provide that eval to the State once received.

22CF84 - Court notes an initial had not been done prior to today. Noting that matter is recommended for DRI, Court calls and completes the initial appearance in this matter, stating the charges and informing the Def of the max. penalties including child porn surcharges. State motions to dismiss and read in this case. Court so orders. 22CF84 DRI for purposes of sentencing in 22CF1.

22CF1 - Def pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2/repeated sexual assault of a child. Court's colloquy with Def. Atty. Covey confirms this was the sole, negotiated offer; it has been thoroughly reviewed and considered by the Defense. Defense concedes factual basis. Court accepts Def's guilty pleas and will enter judgment accordingly. At this time, sentencing deferred for completion of a PSI. State asks sentencing be held in early to mid-February. Defense asks for late January or early March due to counsel's work in a three-week trial. Court sets 3/17 from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. State plans to call expert; Defense asks for disclosure of said witness. 3/1 set as deadline for that exchange. 

Counts 3-20 DRI in 22CF1. PSI author to attending sentencing. PSI to be filed by 1/9/23. Defense will file their report by the same.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on March 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
to court regarding global plea agreement (Atty. Covey)
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM Defendant Joseph R Huddleston in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Edward Covey in court for Joseph R Huddleston. Matter on the calendar for prelim today. Defense has informed the Court that the Def wishes to waive his right to prelim. Atty. Covey presents the Court with written waiver. Court conducts colloquy with Defense re waiver. Waiver accepted. Bindover ordered. Discovery in progress. Defense waives the time limit for State's filing of the information and holding of the arraignment. Court accepts the waiver of arraignment time limits. Arraignment set for 9/14 at 11; could be a plea/sentencing. Court blocks that entire hour off. DA notes that Chapter 950 requirements have been met.
Arraignment scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Harper states that there is a lot of reports. Court resets.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Atty McDougal waives the time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:41 PM Defendant Joseph R Huddleston appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal appears by video. Atty McDougal has received the criminal complaint but hasn't review it with the defendant. 
Court asks about bond. Attorney Harper asks for a $50,000 cash bond with a no contact with the victim, victim's mother, victims father and their residence. Attorney McDougal states that the defendant can't post $50,000 cash bond and asks for a signature bond. Court orders $50,000 cash bond with a no contact with the victim, victim's mother, victims father and their residence.

Court orders Victim Key and Bail be sealed.

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
